oai_dc:dc.dc:title: THE FIRST CORE-LOC BREAKWATER
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Holtzhausen, Anton H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: CORE-LOC
breakwater
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The first project in which Core-Locs were used as the main breakwater armour unit, is a small craft harbour on the south east coast of South Africa named Port St Francis. The Core-Loc was selected based on economic advantages over other units. Stability of 15 t units was confirmed in a full three-dimensional model study. Construction of the harbour commenced in early 1996 and was successfully completed towards the end of 1997. Practical construction issues are discussed in detail. Core-Loc performance under construction stage storms was excellent and virtually no damage has taken place under design storm conditions subsequent to the completion of the structure.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 26 (1998): Proceedings of 26th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Copenhagen, Denmark, 1998.
